did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: League of Red Cross Societies Miscellaneous records,
did.abstract: Correspondence, telegrams, reports, and minutes of meetings, relating to the founding of the League of Red Cross Societies and to relief operations in Europe.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], League of Red Cross Societies Miscellaneous records, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1928.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

Article - "Geneva. Capital of the League of Nations"
Medical Department. Minutes of meetings, 1920 September-December

Drummond to Henderson, 1920 May 31 ("That upon assurance from the League of Nations food, clothing and transportation will be supplied by Governments, the League of red Cross Societies shall at once formulate plans for the immediate extension of voluntary relief within the affected districts." Resolution passed by the General Council in 1920 March)

New items-1922 February 1 ("The following items, collected by the League of Red Cross Societies, are transmitted to those societies by way of supplement to the information and news published under the title of "The Peace Work of the Red Cross" in the January issue of Vers la Sante)

1922 February 17 ("The following notes are issued by the League of Red Cross Societies for the information of member societies and they are to be considered as supplementary to the notes published in the January edition of The World's Health, under the title "Red Cross in Peace")
1922 March 6 (same as above except the notes are supplementary to those published in the February edition)
No. 3, 1922 March 22 (same as above, except the notes are supplementary to those published in the March edition)
No. 5, 1922 May (same as above, except the notes are supplementary to those published in the May edition)
Supplement to No. 5, 1922 May 13 (Junior Red Cross Bulletin)

News release - W. Wilson to Davison, 1919 May 13 ("Permit me to congratulate you and your associates representing the Red Cross Societies of the United States, Great Britain, France, Italy and Japan upon the formation of the League of Red Cross Societies designed to unite the Red Cross societies of the world in active cooperation against the miseries which arise from disease and disaster)
